column5: Thanks to slow poke , I have a need to make pike and musky lures! In line spinners to start! I went to Bills Bait for some supplies and as ussual they had it and some Any way I had to make a few inline spinners today! Off to work I went, twisting the wire, adding beads and blades, then the buck tails So far, 2 were made and many more to come! Initially I used jerk bait leaders for the main wire, but then a hint from a friend turned me to something comparable and a lot cheaper Billy Joel came to mind(hint) For all you lures makers, what do you think? Will they catch a Pike/musky? I hope so!
You're good to go Vinni They look like pike magnet to me Great work dude Leechman
Ya Vin ! they look great.i betcha cant wait to get em in the water !!
Thanks, Bruce and Jacques  More to come!  Hopefully next time around the taper will turn out better, hick up!LOL My poor vice is taking a beating with the wire, in making the loop ends!
Theres some open water around and pike are still in season Paul
well keep us posted Vin.I'm studying for my Muskie debut next season.Got the rod and reel and the lures now.Just need the net and bolt cutters.I want to make sure i do it right.
vice grips and pliers are all that you need, unless you have a good vice it becomes a pita with a small tie flying vice.
Soo tempted!but I was fishing snag city sunday am!No pike there  Just walters! 0/1 More to added tonight
hey they look awesome!  I hope you get into some monsters with those!  cheers!
